question.text: Identify the correct statement from the following.

options.text: Tracheo-bronchial junction is at the level of fifth cervical vertebra.
Inspiratory capacity is the maximum volume of air that can be inspired after normal expiration.

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  in de-oxygenated blood is  <math><mn>40</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> .
Respiratory surface area for exchange of gases is increased in emphysema.

solution.text:
Inspiratory Capacity (IC): Total volume of air a person can inspire after a normal expiration. This includes tidal volume and inspiratory reserve volume ( TV+IRV).

Tracheo-bronchial junction is at the level of fifth thoracic vertebra.
pCO2 in oxygenated blood is 40 mmHg.
Emphysema is a chronic disorder in which alveolar walls are damaged due to which respiratory surface is decreased.
